overview: Our pilot session focused on introductions, sharing what's on our minds, and discovering common threads around productivity, nervous system regulation, and accountability. Jasmine's framework on interrupting rumination spirals sparked significant discussion and immediate application from the group.
topics_covered: What's working and what's challenging right now

standout_moments.title: Framework: Interrupting Rumination Spirals
standout_moments.speaker: Jasmine Mahmoud
standout_moments.core_insight: When we ask ourselves, 'How am I going to do this?' or 'What if it doesn't work?' Those questions put us in a bad state. What if we replace them with: 'What would make today successful?'
standout_moments.group_response: Julie called it 'amazing,' Stara said it could be a TED talk, and Lizzy immediately applied it to her day.

themes.name: Nervous System Over Productivity
themes.description: We don't need better productivity hacks - we need interventions that regulate our nervous system state first.

themes.name: The Power of Better Questions
themes.description: The specific words we use in self-inquiry change our state and outcomes. 'What would make today successful?' vs 'What do I need to get done?' creates completely different energy.

commitments.action: Use her own framework and report back
commitments.context: Doug challenged her to apply what she's teaching

commitments.action: Figure out one thing to do today
